justifications: Switzerland is a member of the European Free Trade Association.
Switzerland's relationship with the EU, which is governed by around 20 major bilateral pacts with the bloc, is broadly similar to the EEA arrangement.
It is outside the customs union, allowing it to negotiate free trade agreements with third countries.
The EU would probably not have wanted a relationship modeled on the Swiss example, either.

target.topic: Swiss concessions on immigration, budget payments, and single-market rules
references: concessions that the Swiss made on immigration, budget payments, and single-market rules

justifications: Brexit supporters who wanted to 'take back control' would not have embraced the concessions that the Swiss made on immigration, budget payments, and single-market rules.
The UK had only two years from triggering Article 50 to negotiate such a deal.
The EU would probably not have wanted a relationship modeled on the Swiss example, either.
The EU would probably not have wanted a relationship modeled on the Swiss example, either.

references: Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond

justifications: Several U.K. politicians, including Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond, stressed the need for a transitional deal of a few years so that (among other reasons) Britain could negotiate EU and third-country trade deals.
This notion was met with resistance from hardline Brexiteers.
